issue.description:

suggestions.reasoning: The current tread length of 0.20 m for Stair.0.3 (ID: 2523201) is below the minimum required length of 0.28 m.

suggestions.action: Redesign Stair.0.3, potentially adjusting its connection to Space 129 or Space 025, to achieve the required tread length.
suggestions.reasoning: The stair (ID: 2523201) has an insufficient tread length. Considering its connections to 'Staircase' spaces (ID: 2658407 and ID: 2653326), a redesign might involve reconfiguring the stair's geometry within the existing space constraints.

suggestions.reasoning: The stair (ID: 2523201) has an insufficient tread length. Given its connection to two 'Staircase' spaces (ID: 2658407 and ID: 2653326), exploring the possibility of expanding or re-shaping these spaces could provide the necessary room for the stair tread adjustment.

issue.description:
307.4 Reduced Vertical Clearance
Underside of stair should be shielded to protect visually impaired persons from accessing it inadvertently.
issue.title: Stair.0.3

suggestions.action: Install a protective barrier or guardrail beneath the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: The stair (id: 2523201) has a reduced vertical clearance, requiring a physical barrier to prevent access for visually impaired individuals.

suggestions.action: Incorporate tactile paving and an auditory warning system beneath the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: The stair (id: 2523201) presents a low-clearance hazard; tactile and auditory cues can alert visually impaired individuals without a physical barrier.

suggestions.action: Design a built-in planter or seating area under the stair.
suggestions.reasoning: The area under the stair (id: 2523201) requires shielding; a planter or seating can serve as a functional and aesthetic obstruction.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.0.1 riser height is 0.20 m. The maximum height for the risers is 0.18 m.
issue.title: Stair.0.1: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Adjust the riser height of Stair.0.1 to be 0.18 m or less.
suggestions.reasoning: The current riser height of 0.20 m for Stair.0.1 exceeds the maximum allowed height of 0.18 m, as indicated by the provided issue and the stair's properties.

suggestions.action: Redesign Stair.0.1 to incorporate more risers, reducing the individual riser height to meet the 0.18 m maximum.
suggestions.reasoning: To comply with the code, the total rise of Stair.0.1 needs to be distributed over a greater number of risers, thereby decreasing the height of each individual riser from 0.20 m to 0.18 m or less.

suggestions.action: Explore alternative stair configurations for Stair.0.1, such as a switchback or L-shaped stair, to accommodate a compliant riser height within the existing space.
suggestions.reasoning: The current straight stair configuration of Stair.0.1 results in an excessive riser height. A different stair layout might allow for a longer run and thus more risers, bringing the individual riser height down to the required 0.18 m or less without altering the overall floor-to-floor height.

issue.description:
504.2 Treads and Risers
Stair Stair.3.2 riser height is 0.20 m. The maximum height for the risers is 0.18 m.
issue.title: Stair.3.2: 0.20 M

suggestions.action: Increase the number of risers to reduce the riser height to 0.1785m.
suggestions.reasoning: The total rise of 12.14m divided by the maximum allowed riser height of 0.18m requires at least 67.44 risers, necessitating an increase to 68 risers, which will extend the stair's horizontal run.

suggestions.action: Introduce a landing to split the stair into two flights, allowing for more risers within a potentially similar footprint.
suggestions.reasoning: Splitting the 12.14m total rise into two flights with a landing allows for 68 risers (0.1785m each) without necessarily extending the stair's overall length in one direction, potentially fitting within existing horizontal dimensions.

suggestions.action: Replace a portion of the stair with a compliant ramp section to reduce the vertical distance covered by risers.
suggestions.reasoning: Integrating a ramp for part of the 12.14m total rise would reduce the required number of risers, allowing the remaining stair section to have a compliant riser height, though this would likely increase the overall footprint.

issue.description:
405.2 Slope
Ramp length is 3.00 m and slope is 10.0%. The maximum length for this slope is 1.52 m.
issue.title: Ramp.0.1: 3.00 M

suggestions.action: Reduce the length of the ramp to 1.52m or less.
suggestions.reasoning: The ramp's current length of 3.0m exceeds the maximum allowed length of 1.52m for its 10% slope.

suggestions.action: Introduce an intermediate landing to break the ramp into two shorter segments, each within the maximum length.
suggestions.reasoning: The ramp's length of 3.0m is too long for a continuous 10% slope. Adding a landing would allow for two shorter, compliant ramp sections.

suggestions.action: Decrease the slope of the ramp to allow for a longer continuous run.
suggestions.reasoning: A 10% slope limits the ramp to 1.52m. Reducing the slope would permit a longer ramp, potentially accommodating the existing 3.0m length without a landing.
